stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the entire stream trying to lock down an art-direction for Course 11. What began as a lava-filled “Frantic Fleet Factory” on top of a volcano slowly pivots into an offshore oil-rig construction site that still builds Bowser’s airships. Most of the work is experimentation with colors, textures and a new ‘rainbow oil’ water shader, while juggling N64 draw-distance and polygon limits.

development_findings.summary: Abandoned the initial ‘lava-on-volcano’ setting after it felt too dark and repetitive; new theme is an oil-rig style construction zone at sea where Bowser’s fleet is assembled.
development_findings.quote: We did all this to get away from lava just to make the level look like lava again, so let’s drop lava and make it an oil rig.

development_findings.summary: Settled on a brighter, cartoon palette: purple-orange oil, yellow-orange metal scaffolding, and deep-blue water reflections to keep “Mario” saturation.
development_findings.quote: Purple, orange and blue. This could look so good—now I’m excited.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a custom ‘oil shimmer’ water shader using rainbow specular highlights driven by shade-color alpha. Required trial-and-error with combiner maths and vertex density.
development_findings.quote: We just need to divide this by six… Ah, there we go—that’s more of a fine film.

development_findings.summary: Doubling vertex count dramatically improves the oil sheen effect but risks performance; Kaze is leaning toward keeping the heavier mesh despite N64 limits.
development_findings.quote: Maybe we just power through it—this actually looks so much better.

development_findings.summary: Skybox can’t be enlarged within current modeling limits; plan is to programme a larger skybox later rather than model it.
development_findings.quote: Literally we can’t do anything about the skybox until the end—we’ll have to program it.

development_findings.summary: Preliminary layout: four distinct rig sections tied together by long pipes; a central plaza hosts the minion strike; separate areas for Bowser’s office, a power-generator, underground flooded tunnels, and steel-beam arenas.
Mission/collectible plan retained: Yoshi coins placed on scaffolds, breakable blocks, Bowser’s office, and sewer area; Red-coin mission atop steel beams.
Considering Bullies as primary enemy because the level is mostly catwalks over lethal fluid.
development_findings.quote: I think Bullies might be good—you run around above the oil, they fit.

development_findings.summary: Texture sourcing: heavy reuse of Mario Sunshine’s Rico Harbor catwalks, Sonic Adventure 2 ‘Metal Harbor’ and Oil Ocean inspirations, plus improvised recolors in Photoshop.
Performance check: current test setup hits 25-30 FPS on real hardware with 10k triangles; bottleneck comes from skybox draw distance and bark model used in test.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values conciseness in both design and communication, repeatedly editing tweets to ‘shorten it more and more until it’s just a few words’.
context_findings.quote: Being concise is one of the most important skills in the world.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration with unsolicited, off-topic suggestions and sets boundaries mid-chat.
context_findings.quote: Please stop giving me random ideas that are completely off topic—I’m not looking for that.

context_findings.summary: Shows visible mood swing from discouragement to excitement once the new color scheme clicks.
context_findings.quote: You start feeling like ‘this is dog-shit’ and suddenly it’s ‘ah, this is gonna be the best thing ever.’

context_findings.summary: Personal life: Zeina is at her parents writing overdue wedding thank-you cards; Kaze leaves early to have dinner with her family.
Mentions paid C++ day-job, four-day/35-hour work-week benefits, and a joking admiration for ‘child labour’ efficiency in user-generated games.
context_findings.quote: If you want to finish a SM64 major hack you need to be mentally ill.

biobak.summary: Suggested bright-yellow infrastructure and black-water/orange-highlight oil, both of which Kaze tested and partially adopted.
biobak.quote: Black water with orange highlights would look sick as hell.

biobak.summary: Reinforces need for vibrant Mario-style saturation; prompts Kaze to re-evaluate dull textures.

key_stories.title: Pivot from Volcano to Oil-Rig
key_stories.summary: Kaze begins the session aiming for a Rico-Harbor-but-lava look. After hours of color tests and community feedback, he abandons lava altogether, re-branding the level as an offshore oil rig that builds Bowser’s airships.
key_stories.challenge: Original lava construction zone looked too dark and overlapped other lava stages.
key_stories.process: Tried Skyward Sword references, experimented with bright lava, blue lava, steampunk ideas, then evaluated oil ocean images and Sunshine catwalk textures.
key_stories.outcome: Final direction is an oil rig with purple-orange oil, yellow scaffolding and Bowser-industry vibes; requires redesign of missions and geometry but excites the team.
key_stories.key_quote: Okay, we’re making it an oil rig—lava is lame and this gives us color.

open_questions.context: Shader now relies on doubled vertex count for finer shimmer, risking frame-rate drops.
questions: Can the effect be optimized without doubling geometry?
How will this perform on real N64 hardware in later, busier scenes?
Could alternative combiner maths achieve similar quality cheaper?

open_questions.context: Multiple palettes (purple/yellow, red/orange, black/orange) were tested but none locked.
questions: Which exact palette will be finalized and when?

open_questions.context: Idea of four rig sections linked by pipes came up to save polygons and pop-in.
